oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ORGANIC IN THE LOCAL VS GLOBAL ANTINOMY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Colombo, Luca
Grando, Stefano
Brunori, Gianluca
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Surveys and statistics
Italy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Increasing attention is paid by European citizens to food chain characteristics, power relations and impacts. Distance travelled by food, its genuinity and capacity to convey cultural and landscape identity, fairness in the value chain and information robustness on quality specifications tend to assume a growing relevance in both public perception and business organisation. A triennial multidisciplinary and multicriteria study, funded under the EU 7th Framework Research Programme, aims to assess the performance of local and global food chains against economic, environmental, social, health and ethical dimensions. This paper examines how organic foods and method of production fits into the local/global discourse, as the subject emerges from an Italian literature review.
